title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be accessed until the source is saved. The user is prompted with the options to save, discard, or cancel the changes. The save option saves the changes, the discard option discards the changes, and the cancel option does nothing and keeps the user on the source page. Additionally, the dialog is titled "Error".
OB: When editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The problem is that the user must figure out how to save the changes or discard them, which is even more difficult. Furthermore, the error message is not clear. The error message displayed is "Source page is dirty".
EB: After editing the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor, switching back to the Layout view should not display an error message. Instead, the switch should be seamless and the changes should be automatically saved or discarded. The error message should also be improved to provide clear guidance to the user.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor. 
2. Switch to the "source" view in the Layout Editor. 
3. Make changes to the XML. 
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view. 
5. Observe the error message indicating the need to save the changes.
